hero.subtitle: A UI/UX designer who enjoys turning messy ideas into clear, thoughtful, and meaningful digital experiences. Currently designing products at Arca Payments and leading design at Datafrik.

resume.title: Resume
resume.summary: I studied Computer Science, where logic meets creativity and empathy does the heavy lifting. I specialize in fintech, education, and travel products.

projects.title: Datafrik
projects.overview: Datafrik is an online learning platform that helps learners acquire practical data skills through hands-on projects and portfolio-building exercises. The platform supports structured learning paths, project-based skill application, and real-world problem solving to prepare users for data careers. The platform is designed for learners of all levels, from beginners to working professionals seeking to upskill, and includes mentorship and guidance features to ensure practical understanding.
projects.solution_text: The redesign focused on clarity, engagement, and practical skill application. We implemented structured learning paths, project-based learning modules, and progress tracking dashboards to improve student retention.
projects.mobile_description: A mobile-friendly learning experience that supports browsing learning paths, tracking progress, and working through projects on the go.

challenges.title: Disorganized learning paths
challenges.text: Learners struggled to navigate courses and projects in a logical, progressive manner.

challenges.title: Lack of practical application
challenges.text: Courses were often theoretical, leaving learners unsure how to apply concepts to real-world problems.

challenges.title: Difficulty tracking progress
challenges.text: Users couldn't easily monitor completed modules or project submissions.

challenges.title: Limited feedback and mentorship
challenges.text: Learners lacked structured guidance, making it hard to understand mistakes or improve.

key_solutions.title: Structured learning paths
key_solutions.text: Courses and projects were organized logically with clear prerequisites and milestones.

key_solutions.title: Project-based learning
key_solutions.text: Assignments were designed to produce portfolio-ready outputs, ensuring practical application.

key_solutions.title: Progress tracking dashboards
key_solutions.text: Learners can monitor their completion status, project progress, and skill development.

key_solutions.title: Mentorship and feedback integration
key_solutions.text: Mentors can provide contextual feedback directly on submitted projects, helping learners iterate quickly.

process.intro: This structured approach ensured that design decisions were grounded in real learner needs while balancing business goals, scalability, and ease of use. Continuous validation with learners and mentors ensured a platform that feels intuitive, engaging, and effective for skill acquisition.

research: Reviewed existing online data learning platforms and user feedback
Observed learner workflows and engagement patterns
analysis: Synthesized findings into core problems around progression clarity, practical application, and mentorship support
Prioritized features that would improve learning outcomes
design: Redesigned dashboards for course navigation, progress tracking, and project management
Developed project-focused flows to make outputs portfolio-ready
test: Conducted usability sessions with learners and mentors
Gathered feedback on navigation, clarity, and engagement

target_users: Aspiring Data Professional: Build practical data skills to advance their career.
Working Professional / Career Switcher: Learn advanced data concepts without disrupting work.
Course Mentor / Instructor: Track learner progress, guide project completion, ensure correct application of concepts.

personas.name: Boluwatife
goals: Build practical data skills to advance their career
Learn at their own pace with clear guidance

personas.name: Paul
goals: Learn advanced data concepts without disrupting work
Gain marketable skills to secure better roles
frustrations: Frustration with abstract or purely theoretical content
Uncertainty about skill relevance to the job market

projects.title: AV Card
projects.overview: Avcard is a virtual card product that allows users to instantly create, fund, and manage digital cards for online payments. The platform focuses on speed, security, and user control.
projects.solution_text: We designed a seamless dashboard that allows instant virtual card creation and custom spending controls. The new flow prioritizes transparency, giving users clear visibility into their transactions and card status.
projects.mobile_description: A mobile-friendly interface that presents virtual cards and transactions in a clear, card-based layout, allowing users to quickly view, manage, and interact with their cards. This intuitive design simplifies navigation, making it easy to create, fund, activate, and track cards on the go.

challenges.title: Frequent Card Declines
challenges.text: Users experienced failed transactions when paying for international services like Netflix and Apple Pay.

challenges.title: Limited Control
challenges.text: Fixed card limits and unclear balances made spending management difficult for power users.

challenges.title: Complex Onboarding
challenges.text: Existing solutions required too many verification steps before users could create their first card.

challenges.title: Low Trust
challenges.text: Unclear PIN flows and limited transparency caused hesitation around online card usage.

key_solutions.title: Instant Virtual Card Creation
key_solutions.text: Users can create new virtual cards in seconds without complex verification steps.

key_solutions.title: Custom Card Controls
key_solutions.text: Each card can be named, funded individually, and assigned spending limits.

key_solutions.title: Clear Activation Feedback
key_solutions.text: Users are clearly informed when a card is created, inactive, activated, or funded.

key_solutions.title: Secure PIN Transactions
key_solutions.text: Every transaction requires a 4-digit PIN, increasing user confidence.

process.intro: This structured approach ensured that design decisions were grounded in real user problems while balancing business needs, security requirements, and scalability. The result was a seamless virtual card experience that feels intuitive, trustworthy, and easy to use.

research: Reviewed existing virtual card products and feedback
Identified common online payment and card usage challenges
analysis: Synthesized findings into key pain points and opportunities
Defined core problems around clarity and reliability
design: Created flows for onboarding, creation, funding, transactions
Designed clear status and feedback states
test: Tested flows to identify usability and friction points
Iterated designs based on feedback and observations

target_users: online shoppers who need reliable payment methods.

personas.name: Ada James
goals: Keep personal and work spending separate

personas.name: Tunde
frustrations: Lack of control over employee spending

projects.title: Airxplora
projects.overview: Airxplora is a travel platform designed to help users discover, book, and manage their travel experiences seamlessly. It offers international flight bookings, hotel reservations, visa applications, travel insurance, and local car hires—all in one platform. The platform targets both leisure and business travelers, providing a centralized solution that simplifies planning, booking, and managing trips while giving users confidence through clear information and trustworthy services.
projects.solution_text: The redesign focused on streamlining and centralizing the travel experience. We prioritized a unified booking flow, simplified interactions through progressive disclosure, and a centralized dashboard for managing all aspects of a trip.
projects.mobile_description: A mobile-friendly travel experience that helps users search, book, and manage trips with a centralized view of bookings, itineraries, and travel documents.

challenges.title: Fragmented travel experience
challenges.text: Users had to switch between multiple apps or websites to complete a single trip.

challenges.title: Complex booking processes
challenges.text: Multi-step booking flows caused confusion and high drop-off rates.

challenges.title: Limited visibility of travel details
challenges.text: Travelers lacked a centralized view of flights, hotels, and other bookings.

challenges.title: Difficulty managing travel documentation
challenges.text: Visa applications, insurance, and other essentials were disconnected from the booking flow.

key_solutions.title: Unified booking flow
key_solutions.text: Flights, hotels, visas, insurance, and car hires integrated into a single, coherent flow.

key_solutions.title: Simplified interactions
key_solutions.text: Multi-step processes were condensed and made intuitive with progressive disclosure and clear guidance.

key_solutions.title: Centralized travel dashboard
key_solutions.text: Users can view all their bookings, itineraries, and documentation in one place.

key_solutions.title: Support for end-to-end travel needs
key_solutions.text: Key travel services like visa applications and insurance were embedded in the workflow, reducing friction.

process.intro: This structured approach ensured that design decisions were grounded in real traveler and planner needs while balancing business goals, operational feasibility, and scalability. Continuous validation with users ensured a seamless, intuitive, and trustworthy travel booking experience.

research: Reviewed competitor travel platforms and user feedback
Observed traveler booking behavior and pain points
Identified common issues in multi-step bookings and itineraries
analysis: Synthesized findings into core problems around complex flows and poor visibility
Prioritized features that improved usability and reduced friction in end-to-end travel
design: Streamlined booking flows for flights, hotels, visas, and insurance
Designed a centralized dashboard for travel management
Integrated support and guidance elements to increase user confidence
test: Conducted usability sessions with leisure and business travelers
Gathered feedback on booking speed, clarity, and overall experience
Iterated on designs based on observations and user suggestions

target_users: Leisure Traveler: Casual traveler planning vacations.
Business Traveler: Frequent traveler managing work trips.
Travel Planner / Admin: Corporate travel coordinator or family trip planner.

personas.name: Joy
goals: Book flights, hotels, and activities efficiently
Keep all travel details organized in one place
frustrations: Lack of clarity on total trip cost
Fragmented access to travel documents (visa, insurance, etc.)

personas.name: Tobe
goals: Track itineraries and essential travel documents
Minimize time spent on travel logistics

projects.title: Arcabill
projects.overview: Arca Bill is an internal billing tool used by the operations team to create, track, and manage bills generated for merchants and customers. The product supports day-to-day billing operations, payment monitoring, and issue resolution, acting as a central place where bills are raised and followed through to completion. The tool is heavily used by internal teams, which means speed, clarity, and accuracy are critical. Any confusion in bill status, ownership, or history directly affects operations, customer communication, and payment resolution.
projects.solution_text: We redesigned Arca Bill with a strong focus on operational clarity, speed, and control. Every design decision was guided by how the ops team actually works on a daily basis and the need to manage bills efficiently at scale.
projects.mobile_description: A responsive operations interface that allows teams to monitor bill statuses, search records quickly, and resolve billing issues efficiently while away from their desks.

challenges.title: Poor visibility into bill status
challenges.text: It was hard to quickly tell which bills were pending, paid, failed, or required follow-up, leading to delays and repeated checks.

challenges.title: Inefficient tracking and follow-ups
challenges.text: Ops teams relied on manual processes to monitor bills, increasing the risk of missed payments and duplicated work.

challenges.title: Limited context on individual bills
challenges.text: Bill details didn't provide enough history or clarity, making issue resolution slower when payments failed or disputes arose.

challenges.title: Scalability issues for daily operations
challenges.text: As billing volume increased, the existing flow didn't support fast filtering, monitoring, or auditing of bills.

key_solutions.title: Introduced clear bill states and visibility
key_solutions.text: Bills were structured around clear, distinct statuses, making it easy to immediately understand what stage each bill was in and what action (if any) was required.

key_solutions.title: Centralized bill monitoring
key_solutions.text: A single, well-organized bills view allowed the team to monitor all bills in one place, reducing the need for manual tracking and repeated status checks.

key_solutions.title: Improved bill detail context
key_solutions.text: Each bill was redesigned to show all relevant information—status, amount, references, timestamps, and history—so issues could be investigated and resolved without switching tools.

key_solutions.title: Designed for operational speed
key_solutions.text: Filtering, sorting, and search were prioritized to help the team quickly find bills, especially during high-volume periods.

key_solutions.title: Built with scale in mind
key_solutions.text: The structure supports increasing bill volumes while maintaining consistency and clarity, ensuring the product remains usable as operations grow.

process.intro: This structured approach ensured that design decisions were grounded in real operational challenges while balancing business needs, accuracy, and scalability. By continuously validating assumptions with internal teams, we were able to deliver a billing tool that improved visibility, reduced manual effort, and supported efficient day-to-day operations.

research: Reviewed the existing Arca Bill workflow and past internal feedback
Observed how the operations team created, tracked, and followed up on bills
analysis: Synthesized findings into clear operational pain points and improvement areas
Defined core problems around bill monitoring, context, and scalability
design: Redesigned key screens to surface bill status and critical information upfront
Simplified bill tracking and monitoring flows to reduce manual effort
test: Validated designs through internal reviews with ops and support teams
Gathered feedback on clarity, speed, and usability of redesigned flows

target_users: Internal Operations Team: Create bills, monitor payment status, handle exceptions.
Finance & Reconciliation Teams: Verify payments, track completed bills, support reconciliation.
Customer Support Team: Resolve merchant or customer payment issues.

personas.name: Dayo Lawal
goals: Track bill status without manual follow-ups
Resolve failed or pending bills efficiently
frustrations: Time wasted searching for bill details
High volume of bills during peak periods
